publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3053 Mr Lloyd Quinan: Report of the Expert Group on MMR—That the Parliament notes the findings of the expert group on MMR; takes into consideration the right for parental choice and the dismissal of the option of single vaccines; further notes that the report highlights the requirement for action on the Public Health Institute for Scotland’s Autistic Spectrum Disorder-Needs Assessment Report, and recommends the immediate implementation of that report’s recommendations.
S1M-3053 Report of the Expert Group on MMR (lodged on 30 April 2002) Alex Neil*

S1M-3053 Mr Lloyd Quinan: Report of the Expert Group on MMR—That the Parliament notes the findings of the expert group on MMR; takes into consideration the right for parental choice and the dismissal of the option of single vaccines; further notes that the report highlights the requirement for action on the Public Health Institute for Scotland’s Autistic Spectrum Disorder-Needs Assessment Report, and recommends the immediate implementation of that report’s recommendations. Supported by: Alex Neil
S1M-3053 Report of the Expert Group on MMR (lodged on 30 April 2002) Christine Grahame*
S1M-3053 Report of the Expert Group on MMR (lodged on 30 April 2002) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-3053 Report of the Expert Group on MMR (lodged on 30 April 2002) Ms Sandra White*
